attention1.ptxt: Failure to follow the following procedure and WARNING may cause air bag deployment, personal injury, damage to parts, or air bag being unable to deploy.

item.ptxt: Never rest a steering column assembly on steering wheel with air bag (inflator) module face down and column vertical.

When handling the air bag (inflator) modules (driver and passenger), be careful not to drop it or apply an impact to it. If an excessive impact was applied (e.g., dropped from a height of 91.4 cm (3 feet) or more, never attempt disassembly or repair but replace it with a new one.
When grease, cleaning agent. Oil, water, etc. has got onto air bag (inflator) modules (driver and passenger), wipe off immediately with a dry cloth.

s1.ptxt: Disable air bag system referring to Disabling Air Bag System .
Recover refrigerant from A/C system using recovery and recycling equipment referring to “Recovery” in Operation Procedure for Charging A/C with Refrigerant .
Drain engine coolant referring to Cooling System Draining .
Remove heater hoses (1) from HVAC unit as follows.

s2.ptxt: Release lock plate (3) completely in arrow direction.

s1.ptxt: Disconnect suction hose (4) and condenser outlet hose (5) by removing attaching bolt (6).
Remove instrument panel referring to Instrument Panel Removal and Installation .
Disconnect rear duct from HVAC unit.
Detach wiring, connectors and clamps from HVAC unit.
Install HVAC unit by reversing removal procedure, noting the following items.

item.ptxt: When installing each part, be careful not to catch any wiring harness.
Connect quick joint (1) to HVAC unit, and then push lock plate (2) completely in arrow direction.
Replenish specified amount of compressor oil to compressor suction side referring to Precautions on Replenishing Compressor Oil .
Install the padding (1) to the installation hole uniformly.
Fill engine coolant referring to step 13) to 20) of Cooling System Refilling .
Enable air bag system referring to Enabling Air Bag System .
Evacuate and charge system. Refer to Operation Procedure for Charging A/C with Refrigerant .
